result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

1:23 PM Defendant Jason Earl Harrison appeared by video.  Attorney Francis P Raff appeared by video for Jason Earl Harrison.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:58 PM Defendant Jason Earl Harrison appeared by video.  Attorney Francis P Raff appeared by video for Jason Earl Harrison.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim, defendant's mother appears by phone. Parties argue bond. Court modifies bond conditions only to: No violent or disorderly contact with victim L.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere, curfew remains in effect, GPS monitoring bracelet no longer ordered, but all other conditions remain in effect. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by October 14, 2022.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No violent or disorderly contact with victim L.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant must remain in residence from 6 PM to 6 AM unless at work or traveling to and from work.

3:22 PM Defendant Jason Earl Harrison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Jason Earl Harrison.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim L.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint with GPS monitor.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant must remain in residence from 6 PM to 6 AM unless at work or traveling to and from work.
